net.acperience.cloudplayer

Class KerberosAuth

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.acperience.cloudplayer.KerberosAuth
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.security.auth.callback.CallbackHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MusicKerberos

    public abstract class KerberosAuth
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.security.auth.callback.CallbackHandler
    The default kerberos configuration is found on linux machines in DoC at /etc/krb5.conf
    The realm to use is IC.AC.UK. The KDCs can be found by running dig -t SRV _kerberos._tcp.ic.ac.uk

    Everything else is pretty much: just follow the tutorial!

    References: http://www.bsg.co.za/web/guest/software_solutions_technical_solution_showcase_java_kerberos

    Implement the abstract methods described
    • getPersistentSubject: Used to see if a subject has been authenticated
    • storePersistentSubject: Used to store a persistent subject upon successful login
    • destroyPersistentSubject: Destroy a persistent subject upon logout
    • getUsername: Used to get a username for authentication
    • getPassword: Used to get a password for authentication
    After constructing the object, to populate the necessary fields, call authenticate()
    Author:
    Lawliet

      • isAuthenticated

        public boolean isAuthenticated()
        Check if we have a subject authenticated. You should call authenticate() first to populate the fields
        Returns:
        whether a user has been authenticated

      • authenticate

        public void authenticate(boolean doLogin)
                  throws javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
        Authenticates and populate the subject field of the class Method will first attempt to load a persistent subject. Failing that, will attempt to load a subject from the LoginContext If that fails, depending on whether doLogin is set to true or not, will perform a login
        Parameters:
        doLogin - Set to true to perform a login
        Throws:
        javax.security.auth.login.LoginException

      • authenticate

        public void authenticate()
                  throws javax.security.auth.login.LoginException,
                         java.lang.SecurityException
        Convenience method to do a login by default
        Throws:
        javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
        java.lang.SecurityException

        public void logout()

      • getPersistentSubject

        public abstract javax.security.auth.Subject getPersistentSubject()
        Override this method to allow the class to retrieve any stored authenticated subjects If no one has been authenticated, return NULL and the class will attempt to authenticate If not using persistent subjects, just override an empty method.
        Returns:
        The subject stored in some persistent storage or NULL if none

      • storePersistentSubject

        protected abstract void storePersistentSubject(javax.security.auth.Subject subject)
        Store a persistent subject. Called after a successful login attempt. If not storing, just override an empty method

      • destroyPersistentSubject

        protected abstract void destroyPersistentSubject()
        Destroys a persistent subject upon successful logout attempt. If not using persistent subject, override an empty method

      • getUsername

        public abstract java.lang.String getUsername()
        Override this method to allow the class to get a username for authentication purposes if necessary
        Returns:
        Username for authentication

      • getPassword

        public abstract java.lang.String getPassword()
        Override this method to allow the class to get a password for authentication purposes if necessary
        Returns:
        Password for authentication
